description: CHANGE OF USE FROM A1 (SHOPS) TO D2
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.
Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: Site Map, SH.08, SH.01, SH.09 and SH.10

Condition : 3 - The facing materials used in the development hereby permitted shall match those of the existing building in materials, style, colour, texture and, in the case of brickwork, bonding, coursing and pointing.

Condition : 4 - The premises shall only be used for a fitness studio and for no other purpose, (including any other purpose within Class D2 of the Schedule to the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes Order) 1987), or in any provision equivalent to that Class in any statutory instrument revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification.

Condition : 5 - Noise levels, (expressed as the equivalent continuous sound level) LAeq (10 minutes), from the new use hereby permitted shall not exceed LA90-10dB at the boundary with the closest residential property.  

Reason: To safeguard the amenities and privacy of the occupiers of adjoining properties and to comply with the following Development Plan policies for Merton: policy 7.6 of the London Plan 2016, policy CS14 of Merton's Core Planning Strategy 2011 and policies DM D2 and D3 of Merton's Sites and Policies Plan 2014.

Condition : 6 - The use, hereby approved, shall not commence until the scheme for the soundproofing of the building to prevent the transmission of noise from the use of the fitness studio as detailed in the ACA acoustics report dated 20 April 2019, reference 190307-R001A have been fully implementedand installed on site. The measures as detailed shall be implemented in strict accordance with the approved details prior to the first use of the development and shall thereafter be retained.

Reason: To safeguard the amenities and privacy of the occupiers of adjoining properties and to comply with the following Development Plan policies for Merton: policy 7.6 of the London Plan 2016, policy CS14 of Merton's Core Planning Strategy 2011 and policies DM D2 and D3 of Merton's Sites and Policies Plan 2014.

Condition : 7 - A post completion survey assessment shall be undertaken to show compliance with the aforementioned report and submitted to the Local Planning Authority within 4 weeks of the premises in operation and any deficiencies remediated with additional mitigation measures. The implemented mitigation strategy shall be demonstrated to the Local Planning Authority upon completion.

Reason: To safeguard the amenities and privacy of the occupiers of adjoining properties and to comply with the following Development Plan policies for Merton: policy 7.6 of the London Plan 2016, policy CS14 of Merton's Core Planning Strategy 2011 and policies DM D2 and D3 of Merton's Sites and Policies Plan 2014.

Condition : 8 - The use hereby permitted shall be limited to a fitness studio rather than for weight lifting.

Reason: To safeguard the amenities and privacy of the occupiers of adjoining properties and to comply with the following Development Plan policies for Merton: policy 7.6 of the London Plan 2016, policy CS14 of Merton's Core Planning Strategy 2011 and policies DM D2 and D3 of Merton's Sites and Policies Plan 2014.
Condition : 9 - The use hereby permitted shall operate only between the hours of 6:00am to 21:00pm Monday to Friday, 7:30am to 15:30pm on Saturdays and 9:00am to 15:00pm Sundays and Bank Holidays.

Condition : 10 - In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:

   i) Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
   ii) Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
   iii) As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.

In this instance:

   i) The application was acceptable as submitted and no further assistance was required.
   ii) The application was approved without delay.
